content: Cool redesign. I like your systematic approach and testing with real users. That said I feel like you kind of miss the point of VSCO. Part of its appeal is the hard-to-use-hipster-exclusive vibe that the app does so well. Making the app more useable would be against its fundamental design philosophy. Similar to Snapchat I genuinely believe that some of the icons without labels leads to a discover based user experience that can be rewarding. If you’re looking for a fast easy to use app for filters there’s already plenty of alternatives.
